com.algolia.instantsearch.core.helpers

Class Searcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algolia.instantsearch.core.helpers.Searcher

  • public class Searcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the state of the search interface, wrapping an Algolia API Client and provide a level of abstraction over it.

    The Searcher is responsible of interacting with the Algolia engine: when search() is called, the Searcher will fire a request with the current query, and will forward the search results (or error) to its result listeners (or error listeners).

    • Field Summary

      The variant identifying this Searcher.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static Searcher get()
        Gets the default Searcher.
        Returns:
        the only (or alternatively the first) Searcher instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no searcher was created before.

      • get

        public static Searcher get(java.lang.String variant)
        Gets the Searcher for a given variant.
        Parameters:
        variant - an identifier to differentiate this Searcher from eventual others.
        Returns:
        the corresponding Searcher instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no searcher was created before for this variant.

      • create

        public static Searcher create(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String appId,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String apiKey,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String indexName)
        Constructs a Searcher, creating its searchable and client with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        appId - your Algolia Application ID.
        apiKey - a search-only API Key. (never use API keys that could modify your records! see https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/security/api-keys)
        indexName - the name of the searchable to target.
        Returns:
        the new instance.

                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String variant)
        Constructs a Searcher, creating its searchable and client with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        appId - your Algolia Application ID.
        apiKey - a search-only API Key. (never use API keys that could modify your records! see https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/security/api-keys)
        indexName - the name of the searchable to target.
        variant - an identifier to differentiate this Searcher from eventual others.
        Returns:
        the new instance.

      • forwardBackendSearchResult

        @NonNull
public Searcher forwardBackendSearchResult(@NonNull
                                                    org.json.JSONObject response)
        Forwards the given algolia response to the results listeners.

        This method is useful if you rely on a backend implementation, but still want to use InstantSearch Android in your frontend application.

        Parameters:
        response - the response sent by the algolia server.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given response is malformated.

      • loadMore

        @NonNull
public Searcher loadMore()
        Loads more results with the same query.

        Note that this method won't do anything if hasMoreHits() returns false.

        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • hasMoreHits

        public boolean hasMoreHits()
        Checks if we should load more hits when reaching the end of the current list of hits.
        Returns:
        true unless we reached the end of hits or we already requested a new page.

      • addFacet

        @Deprecated
public void addFacet(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String attribute,
                                 boolean isDisjunctive,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
        Deprecated. this will be removed in v2.0, use addFacetRefinement(String, List, boolean) instead.
        Adds a facet refinement for the next queries.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the facet name.
        isDisjunctive - if true, the facet will be added as a disjunctive facet.
        values - an eventual list of values to refine on.

      • setFacet

        public Searcher setFacet(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String attribute,
                         boolean isDisjunctive)
        Sets a given facet as disjunctive or conjunctive.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The facet's name.
        isDisjunctive - true to treat this facet as disjunctive (`OR`), false to treat it as conjunctive (`AND`, the default).
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • addFacetRefinement

        @NonNull
public Searcher addFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                            java.lang.String attribute,
                                            @NonNull
                                            java.lang.String value)
        Adds a facet refinement for the next queries.

        This method resets the current page to 0.

        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to refine on.
        value - the facet's value to refine with.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • addFacetRefinement

        public Searcher addFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                   java.lang.String attribute,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> values,
                                   boolean isDisjunctive)
        Adds a facet refinement for the next queries.

        This method resets the current page to 0.

        Parameters:
        attribute - the facet name.
        values - an eventual list of values to refine on.
        isDisjunctive - if true, the facet will be added as a disjunctive facet.

        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • updateFacetRefinement

public Searcher updateFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                               java.lang.String attribute,
                                               @NonNull
                                               java.lang.String value,
                                               boolean active)
        Adds or removes this facet refinement for the next queries according to its enabled status.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to facet on.
        value - the value for this attribute.
        active - if true, this facet value is currently refined on.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • hasFacetRefinement

        public boolean hasFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String attribute,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String value)
        Checks if a facet refinement is enabled.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to refine on.
        value - the facet's value to check.
        Returns:
        true if attribute is being refined with value.

      • getFacetRefinements

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFacetRefinements(@NonNull
                                                                      java.lang.String attribute)
        Gets the refinement values for a faceted attribute.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute refined on.
        Returns:
        the refinements enabled for the given attribute, or null if there is none.

      • clearFacetRefinements

        This method resets the current page to 0.

      • getNumericRefinement

public NumericRefinement getNumericRefinement(@NonNull
                                                        java.lang.String attribute,
                                                        int operator)
        Gets the current numeric refinement for an attribute and an operator.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to refine on.
        operator - one of the operators defined in NumericRefinement.
        Returns:
        a NumericRefinement describing the current refinement for these parameters, or null if there is none.

      • removeFacet

        public Searcher removeFacet(java.lang.String... attributes)
        Removes one or several faceted attributes for the next queries. If the facet was added several times, you need to call this method several times too or use deleteFacet(java.lang.String...).
        Parameters:
        attributes - one or more attribute names.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • deleteFacet

        public Searcher deleteFacet(java.lang.String... attributes)
        Forces removal of one or several faceted attributes for the next queries.
        Parameters:
        attributes - one or more attribute names.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • setQuery

        @NonNull
public Searcher setQuery(@NonNull
                                  com.algolia.search.saas.Query query)
        Takes the given query's parameters for following search queries.

        This method resets the current page to 0.

        Parameters:
        query - a Query object with some parameters set.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • getSearchable

        Returns:
        the Searcher's index.

      • getIndex

        @Deprecated
public com.algolia.search.saas.Index getIndex()
        Deprecated. use getSearchable() to get the Searcher's searchable regardless of its implementation.
        Gets the current searchable as an Index.
        Returns:
        the Searcher's index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if searchable if not an instance of Index

      • setIndex

        @NonNull
public Searcher setIndex(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String indexName)
        Changes the targeted index for future queries.

        Be aware that as index ordering may differ, this method will reset the current page to 0. You may want to use reset() to reinitialize the helper to an empty state.

        Parameters:
        indexName - name of the new index.
        Returns:
        this Searcher for chaining.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Unregisters and cleans up the searcher when is no longer needed.

      • getFacetStat

        @Nullable
public FacetStat getFacetStat(java.lang.String attribute)
        Gets the statistics associated with a given facet.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the facet's name.
        Returns:
        an object describing the min, max, average and sum of the facet's values.

      • getUpdatedFacetStats

        public void getUpdatedFacetStats()
        Updates the facet stats, calling Index.search(Query, RequestOptions) without notifying listeners of the result.
